_meanings:
{@--1@} As a prefix to verbs
it implies separation (away from,
outside of), certainty, completeness
or fulness, enjoyment, crossing over,
transgressing &c.; (for examples see
under {#nir#}).

{@--2@} As a prefix to nouns,
not directly derived from verbs, it
forms nouns or adjectives, and has
the sense of ({%a%}) ‘out of’, ‘away
from’; as in {#nirvana, nizkOSAMbi#}; or
({%b%}) more usually, ‘not’, ‘without’,
devoid of’ (having a privative force);
{#niHSeza#} ‘without a remainder’; {#nizPala#},
{#nirjala#} &c. {%<ab>N. B.</ab>%} In compound the
{#s#} of {#nis#} is changed to {#r#} before 
vowels and soft consonants (see {#nir#}),
to a visarga before sibilants, to {#S#}
before {#c#} and {#C#}, and to {#z#} before {#k#}
and {#p#}; <ab>cf.</ab> {#dus#}.

{2} free
from thorns or enemies, free from
danger or nuisance.

{3} <ab>N.</ab> of Brahmā.
({#lA, --lI#}) an elderly woman, one who
is past child-bearing, or one in whom
menstruation has ceased.

({#nizkazAya#} &c.) {%<ab>a.</ab>%} free
from dirt or impure passions.

{1} free from wish or
desire, desireless, disinterested,
unselfish.

{2} disinterested,
free from any motive; {#nizkAraRo baMDuH#}.

{3} groundless, not proceeding from
any cause.

without any
cause or reason, causelessly, 
needlessly.

a 
penitent shaven and smeared with 
clarified butter.

{1} one whose term of life is over
or elapsed, whose days are 
numbered.

{2} one who has no conqueror,
invincible ({#ajayya#}).

who has
gone out of Kauśāmbī.

not in one's
right senses, mad.

depriving (one) of
motion, causing motionlessness (said
of one of the arrows of Cupid)

{2} freed from sin or
moral impurities.

destitute
of fire, heat or energy, powerless,
impotent.

destitute of the three qualities ({#sattva#}, 
{#rajas#}, and {#tamas#}).

a
woman having no husband and no
sons.

an
ascetic without family, dependents,
or other belongings

{1} {%<ab>a.</ab>%} without distinction of
species, without specification, 
absolute.

{2} without the relation of the
qualifier and the qualified, see {#nirvikalpa#}
(7); {#nizprakArakaM jYAnaM nirvikalpakaM#} T.
S.

{1} not moving away, 
remaining in one place.

{1} without motive, not
influenced by any motive.

free from fear or risk, 
secure, fearless.

not expressed in words, inaudible;
{#niHSabdaM roditumAreme#} <ls>K. 135.</ls>

a retired place, solitude; {#araRye niH#}
{#SalAke vA maMtraMyadaviBAvitaH#} <ls>Ms. 7. 147.</ls>

{1} not attached or 
devoted to, regardless of, indifferent
to; {#yanniHsaMgastvaM PalasyAnateByaH#}  
<ls>Ki. 18. 24.</ls>

{2} one who has renounced all
worldly attachments; <ls>Mu. 1. 14.</ls>

having no joints perceptible, 

compact, firm, close.

{2} not claimed by another, 
belonging exclusively to one possessor.

the darkness of midnight,
thick darkness.

{1} sapless, pithlessness; <ls>Pt. 1. 106.</ls>
{2} worthlessness. 
{3} vanity, 
unsubstantial or transitory nature.

{1} not unctuous or greasy, 
without unction or oil, dry.

{2} not 
showing affection, unfeeling, unkind, 
indifferent.
